englishTranslationText: In	order	to	benefit	you	and	your	cattle.
romanUrduTranslationText: Tumhāre	aur	tumhāre	chaupāyoñ	ke	fāide	ko.

englishTranslationText: So	when	the	greatest	universal	disaster	arrives,
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	jab	āaye	giwoh	‘ām	musibat	sab	se	badi

englishTranslationText: On	that	day	man	will	recall	all	what	he	strove	for.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	din	āadmi	yād	kare	gā	jo	koshish	ki	thi

englishTranslationText: And	hell	will	be	made	visible	to	all	those	who	can	see.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Jahannam	har	dekhne	wāle	par	zāhir	ki	jāye	gi

englishTranslationText: So	for	one	who	rebelled,
romanUrduTranslationText: To	woh	jis	ne	sarkashi	ki

englishTranslationText: And	preferred	the	worldly	life,
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	duniyā	ki	zindagi	ko	tarjeeḥ	di

englishTranslationText: Then	indeed	hell	only	is	his	destination.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	be-shak	Jahannam	hi	us	kā	thikānā	hai

arabicText: وَأَمَّا مَنْ خَافَ مَقَامَ رَبِّهِۦ وَنَهَى ٱلنَّفْسَ عَنِ ٱلْهَوَىٰ
englishTranslationText: And	for	one	who	feared	to	stand	before	his	Lord	and	restrained	his	soul	from	desire,
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	woh	jo	apne	Rab	ke	ḥuzoor	khade	hone	se	darā	aur	nafs	ko	khwāhish	se	rokā

englishTranslationText: Then	indeed	Paradise	only	is	his	destination.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	be-shak	Jannat	hi	thikānā	hai

englishTranslationText: (the	disbelievers)	ask	you	regarding	the	Last	Day,	as	to	when	is	its	appointed	time.
romanUrduTranslationText: Tum	se	Qiyāmat	ko	poochte	haiñ	ke	woh	kab	ke	liye	thahri	huyi	hai

englishTranslationText: What	concern	do	you	have	regarding	its	explanation?	(You	are	not	bound	to	tell	them)
romanUrduTranslationText: Tumheñ	us	ke	bayān	se	kyā	t’alluq

englishTranslationText: Towards	your	Lord	only	is	its	conclusion.
romanUrduTranslationText: Tumhāre	Rab	hi	tak	us	ki	intihā	hai.

englishTranslationText: You	are	but	a	Herald	of	Warning,	for	one	who	fears	it.
romanUrduTranslationText: Tum	to	faqaṭ	usey	darāne	wāle	ho	jo	us	se	dare.

arabicText: كَأَنَّهُمْ يَوْمَ يَرَوْنَهَا لَمْ يَلْبَثُوٓا۟ إِلَّا عَشِيَّةً أَوْ ضُحَىٰهَا
englishTranslationText:
The	day	when	they	will	see	it,	it	will	seem	as	if	they	had	not	stayed	on	earth	except	for	an	evening	
or	its	morning.
romanUrduTranslationText: Goyā	jis	din	woh	usey	dekheñ	ge	duniyā	meiñ	na	rahe	the	magar	aik	sham	yā	us	ke	din	chadhe

englishTranslationText: He	frowned	and	turned	away.
romanUrduTranslationText: Tewri	chardhāyi	aur	muñh	pherā

englishTranslationText:
Because	the	blind	man	had	come	in	his	
august	presence.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Us	par	ke	us	ke	pās	woh	nā-beenā	ḥāzir	
huā

englishTranslationText:
And	what	do	you	know,	he	may	be	of	the	
pure!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tumheñ	kyā	m’aloom	shāyad	woh	
suthrā	ho

englishTranslationText:
Or	that	he	may	accept	advice,	so	the	advice	
may	benefit	him.
romanUrduTranslationText: Yā	nasiḥat	le	to	usey	nasiḥat	fāida	de

englishTranslationText: For	him	who	does	not	care,
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	jo	be	parwāh	bantā	hai

englishTranslationText: So	you	are	after	him!
romanUrduTranslationText: Tum	us	ke	to	peeche	padte	ho

englishTranslationText:
And	you	have	nothing	to	lose	if	he	does	not	
become	pure.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	tumhārā	kuch	ziyāñ	nahiñ	is	meiñ	ke	
woh	suthrā	na	ho

englishTranslationText: And	for	him	who	came	to	you	striving,
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	woh	jo	tumhāre	ḥuzoor	malaktā	(nāz	
se	doudtā	huā)	āayā

englishTranslationText: And	whereas	he	fears,
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	woh	dar	rahā	hai

englishTranslationText:
So	you	leave	him,	and	are	engrossed	
elsewhere!
romanUrduTranslationText:
To	usey	chord	kar	aur	ṭaraf	mashghool	
hote	ho.

englishTranslationText: Not	this	way	–	this	is	the	advice.
romanUrduTranslationText: Yuñ	nahiñ	ye	to	samjhānā	hai

englishTranslationText: So	whoever	wishes	may	remember	it
romanUrduTranslationText: To	jo	chāhe	usey	yād	kare

englishTranslationText: On	honourable	pages.
romanUrduTranslationText: Un	saḥifoñ	meiñ	ke	‘izzat	wāle	haiñ

englishTranslationText: Exalted,	pure.
romanUrduTranslationText: Balandi	wāle	pāki	wāle

englishTranslationText: Written	by	the	hands	of	emissaries.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aisoñ	ke	hāth	likhe	huye.

englishTranslationText: Who	are	noble,	virtuous.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jo	karam	wāle	nikoyi	wāle

englishTranslationText: May	man	be	slain	–	how	ungrateful	he	is!
romanUrduTranslationText: Āadmi	mārā	jaiyo	kyā	nā	shukra	hai.

englishTranslationText: From	what	did	He	create	him?
romanUrduTranslationText: Usey	kāhe	se	banāyā

englishTranslationText: From	a	drop	of	liquid;	He	created	him	and	then	set	several	measures	for	him.
romanUrduTranslationText: Pāni	ki	boñd	se	usey	paidā	farmāyā	phir	usey	ṭaraḥ	ṭaraḥ	ke	andāzoñ	par	rakhā

englishTranslationText: Then	eased	the	way	for	him.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	usey	rāsta	āasān	kiyā

englishTranslationText: Then	gave	him	death,	so	had	him	put	in	the	grave.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	usey	maut	di	phir	qabr	meiñ	rakhwāyā

englishTranslationText:
Then,	when	He	willed,	He	brought	him	out.	(As	during	the	night	of	Holy	Prophet’s	ascension,	when	
all	the	Prophets	gathered	behind	him	in	the	Al	Aqsa	masjid	in	Jerusalem.	Or	when	Allah	will	raise	
everyone	on	the	Day	of	Resurrection.)
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	jab	chāhā	usey	bāhar	nikālā

englishTranslationText: Not	one	–	he	has	not	yet	completed	what	he	was	commanded.
romanUrduTranslationText: Koyi	nahiñ	us	ne	ab	tak	poorā	na	kiyā	jo	usey	ḥukm	huā	thā

englishTranslationText: So	man	must	look	at	his	food.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	āadmi	ko	chāhiye	apne	khānoñ	ko	dekhe

englishTranslationText: That	We	watered	it	in	abundance.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ke	ham	ne	achchi	ṭaraḥ	pāni	dālā

englishTranslationText: Then	We	split	the	earth	properly.
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	zameen	ko	khoob	cheerā.

englishTranslationText: Thereby	produced	grain	in	it.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	us	meiñ	ugāyā	anāj.

englishTranslationText: And	grapes	and	fodder,
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	angoor	aur	chāra.

englishTranslationText: And	olives	and	date	palms,
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	zaitoon	aur	khajoor.

englishTranslationText: And	dense	gardens,
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	ghane	bāgheeche

englishTranslationText: And	fruits	and	grass,
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	mewe	aur	doob	(ghās)

englishTranslationText: In	order	to	benefit	you	and	your	cattle.
romanUrduTranslationText: Tumhāre	fāide	ko	aur	tumhāre	chaupāyoñ	ke

englishTranslationText: So	when	the	deafening	Shout	arrives,
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	jab	āayegi	woh	kān	phādne	wāli	chinghād

englishTranslationText: On	that	day	man	will	run	away	from	his	brother.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	din	ādmi	bhāge	gā	apne	bhāyi

englishTranslationText: And	from	his	mother	and	father,
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	māñ	aur	bāp

englishTranslationText: And	from	his	wife	and	sons.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	joru	(biwi)	aur	betoñ	se

arabicText: لِكُلِّ ٱمْرِئٍۢ مِّنْهُمْ يَوْمَئِذٍۢ شَأْنٌۭ يُغْنِيهِ
englishTranslationText: On	that	day,	each	one	has	just	one	issue,	which	is	enough	for	him.
romanUrduTranslationText: In	meiñ	se	har	aik	ko	us	din	aik	fikr	hai	ke	wohi	usey	bas	hai

englishTranslationText: Many	a	face	will	be	glittering	on	that	day.
romanUrduTranslationText: Kitne	muñh	us	din	raushan	hoñge

englishTranslationText: Laughing,	rejoicing.
romanUrduTranslationText: Hañste	khushiyāñ	manāte

englishTranslationText: And	many	a	face	will	be	covered	with	dust	on	that	day.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	kitne	muñhoñ	par	us	din	gar’d	padi	hogi

englishTranslationText: Blackness	overcoming	them.
romanUrduTranslationText: Un	par	siyāhi	chardh	rahi	hai

englishTranslationText: It	is	they,	the	disbelievers,	the	sinners.
romanUrduTranslationText: Ye	wohi	haiñ	kāfir	badkār.

englishTranslationText: When	the	sunlight	is	rolled	up.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jab	dhoop	lapeti	jāye

englishTranslationText: And	when	the	stars	fall	down.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	tāre	jhard	padeiñ

englishTranslationText: And	when	the	mountains	are	driven.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	phārd	chalāye	jāyeñ

englishTranslationText: And	when	milch	camels	roam	abandoned.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	(gābhan)	ooñtniyāñ	chooti	phireñ

englishTranslationText:
And	when	wild	animals	are	herded	
together.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	weḥshi	jānwar	jam’a	kiye	jāyeñ

englishTranslationText: And	when	the	seas	are	set	afire.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	samundar	sulgāye	jāyeñ

englishTranslationText: And	when	the	souls	are	paired.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	jānoñ	ke	jord	baneñ

englishTranslationText:
And	when	the	girl-child	who	was	buried	
alive	is	asked.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	zinda	dabāyi	huyi	se	poochā	jāye

englishTranslationText: Upon	what	sin	was	she	killed	for.
romanUrduTranslationText: Kis	khaṭā	par	māri	gayi

englishTranslationText:
And	when	the	Records	of	Account	are	laid	
bare.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	Nāma-e-A’amāl	khole	jāyeñ

englishTranslationText: And	when	the	heaven	is	torn	away.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	āsmān	jagah	se	kheeñch	liyā	jāye

englishTranslationText: And	when	hell	is	further	enflamed.		.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	Jahannam	ko	bhadkāyā	jāye

englishTranslationText: And	when	Paradise	is	brought	near.			.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	jab	Jannat	pās	lāyi	jāye

englishTranslationText:
Every	soul	will	then	come	know	what	it	has	
brought.				.
romanUrduTranslationText: Har	jān	ko	m’aloom	ho	jāye	gā	jo	ḥāzir	lāyi

englishTranslationText:
So	by	oath	of	those	that	revolve.	(The	
planets.)				.
romanUrduTranslationText: To	qasam	hai	un	ki	jo	ulte	phireñ.

englishTranslationText: Who	move	straight	and	stop.			.
romanUrduTranslationText: Seedhe	chaleñ	tham	raheñ

englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	the	night	when	it	turns	back.			.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	rāt	ki	jab	pith	de

englishTranslationText: And	by	oath	of	the	morning	when	it	takes	birth.			.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	subḥ	ki	jab	dam	le

englishTranslationText:
This	is	indeed	the	recitation	of	an	honoured	Noble	Messenger.	(Angel	Jibreel	–	peace	and	blessings	
be	upon	him.)			.
romanUrduTranslationText: Be-shak	ye	‘izzat	wāle	Rasool	kā	pardhnā	hai.

arabicText: ذِى قُوَّةٍ عِندَ ذِى ٱلْعَرْشِ مَكِينٍۢ
englishTranslationText: The	mighty,	the	honoured	in	the	presence	of	the	Lord	of	the	Throne.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jo	quwwat	wālā	hai	Mālik-e-‘Arsh	ke	ḥuzoor	‘izzat	wālā

englishTranslationText: The	one	who	is	obeyed,	and	trustworthy.	(Other	angels	obey	angel	Jibreel).
romanUrduTranslationText: Wahāñ	us	kā	ḥukm	mānā	jātā	hai	amānat	dār	hai

englishTranslationText: And	your	companion	is	not	insane.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	tumhāre	sāḥib	majnoon	nahiñ

englishTranslationText:
And	indeed	he	saw	him	on	the	clear	horizon.	(Prophet	Muhammad	saw	Angel	Jibreel	in	his	true	
shape	–	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	them).
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	be-shak	unhoñ	ne	use	roshan	kināre	par	dekhā

englishTranslationText:
And	this	Prophet	is	not	miserly	upon	the	hidden.	(Allah	gave	the	knowledge	of	the	hidden	to	the	
Holy	Prophet	–	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	him.)
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	ye	Nabi	ghaib	batāne	meiñ	bakheel	nahiñ.

englishTranslationText: And	the	Qur’an	is	not	the	recitation	of	Satan	the	outcast.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	Qur’ān	mardood	shaiṭān	kā	pardhā	huā	nahiñ.

englishTranslationText: So	where	are	you	going?
romanUrduTranslationText: Phir	kidhar	jāte	ho

englishTranslationText: That	is	but	an	advice	to	the	entire	creation!
romanUrduTranslationText: Woh	to	nasiḥat	hi	hai	sāre	jahāñ	ke	liye.

englishTranslationText: For	the	one	among	you	who	wishes	to	become	upright.
romanUrduTranslationText: Us	ke	liye	jo	tum	meiñ	seedhā	honā	chāhe

arabicText: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّ ٱلْعَـٰلَمِينَ
englishTranslationText: And	what	will	you	wish,	except	if	Allah	wills	–	the	Lord	of	the	Creation.
romanUrduTranslationText: Aur	tum	kyā	chāho	magar	ye	ke	chāhe	Allāh	sāre	jahān	kā	Rab.

englishTranslationText: When	the	heaven	splits	open.
romanUrduTranslationText: Jab	āsmān	phat	pade..
